intro: Parrya subscapigera, commonly known as the scapose parrya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, leafless stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Parrya subscapigera is notable for its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
